sub_topic: Identifying the Lewis structure of a molecule
message_1: What is the Lewis structure of the hydrogen peroxide molecule (H2O2)?
message_2:
The Lewis structure of the hydrogen peroxide molecule (H2O2) can be represented as follows:

O - H
  |
H - O

In this structure, each oxygen atom is bonded to one hydrogen atom and has two lone pairs of electrons. The oxygen atoms are also connected by a single bond, which represents two shared electrons.
